title: Chateau Rauzan-Segla Margaux 2012
description:
Margaux lovers! This is the day! Our France container just landed and man, we could not wait to get into it! Chateau Rauzan Segla was once part of a much larger property in 1661, when merchant and farmer Pierre de Rauzan acquired the house and the first parcels of vines around it. Classified a 2nd Growth, it has firmly established itself as a "super 2nd". It’s also well-known that it was quite the favorite of one Thomas Jefferson, and since being acquired by Chanel, it has only risen in quality and status.

Simply wonderful at this young age - if you prefer your Bordeaux with some youthful energy, this is 100% your jam right now and into the next decade. We loved the crushed flowers, ripe red fruits, black truffles, and the terrific balance so key to enjoying these. Silky, defined, elegant, classy. Don't miss...!

PAIRING IDEAS: Lamb or beef skewers. Simple, clean, with EVOO, a bit of thyme, S+P, grill and drizzle with more oil. Crumble some good feta or feta-like cheese. The best part? Grill some naan bread and wrap it up with some salad.

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: We need some upbeat tunes – hopeful. Going back to college, how about “New World Man” by Rush? We could use a hero right now!
summary: Chateau Rauzan-Segla is ranked as a second growth in the 1855 classification and has been enjoyed by many well-known figures. The most famous is Thomas Jefferson who purchased several cases during his visit to the vineyards of Bordeaux. The current chateau was built in 1903 and was designed by the architect Louis Garros who admired the original Pyrigord style buildings. As time went by the chateau was quiet but was purchased in 1994 by Chanel which immediately started a full renovation of the estate.

title: Domaine Laporte Sancerre Rosé Les Grandmontains 2020
description:
We sort of wish it was Thanksgiving again -- this would be just killer with that particular meal for sure. Although honestly, it’s terrific all by itself in our glass as we write this! A cool bottle to have around and straight-up delish!

Laporte is based in Chavignol, a small village in Sancerre that takes great pride in its wines. Laporte happens to be just down the road from one of the most highly regarded producers in all of Sancerre, Francois Cotat.

This is like Barry White in a pink tux, smooth and seductive. With a salmon color and crisp aromas of white cherry, red berries, stones and flowers...this is all class. The flavors are bright and fresh, with baritone undertones of red berry and mineral that cut the center and leave you ready for your next glass.

Speaking of that, this is already flying out the door...grab it while it's here!

PAIRING IDEAS: Got a turkey? Go for it! Although, a perfectly roasted chicken would be amazing with this! Cook it with a bunch of mushrooms and thyme and such, and make a light cream sauce with the drippings. Here’s a solid recipe for something along those lines (replace the tarragon with thyme, unless you love it like we do). Perfect with this pinot-based rose!

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: Dave Grohl covering Van Halen’s “Jump” is a fun one that dropped yesterday. He’s got a whole portfolio of these from the “Hanukkah Sessions”. Google it to find your jam, he’s probably covered it! Or Barry White :)
summary: A small multigenerational family winery has a long history in the Chavignol region of Loire France. The Serge Laporte vineyards are located on several different exposed sites with their rose grapes coming from their younger vines parcel (age of vines are 15 years old). The Pinot Noir does extremely well in the argile-calcaire and clay-limestone soils because it creates wines with great structure that are long-lived. Serge's son, Guillaume, has since taken over his father's position as winemaker and continues to excel and produce fantastic wines.

title: Nellcote Cabernet Sauvignon Rallye 76 Napa Valley 2016
description:
A serendipitous lunch meeting at Mustards Grill in Yountville began a partnership between Tyler Olbres, a successful designer, and Phillip Corallo-Titus, esteemed winemaker at Chappellet Vineyards for over a quarter century. This is a true hedonistic delight, just beautifully done, in a bottle that weighs about 5 pounds. Napa cab lovers will find an immensely concentrated, seamless, exceptionally crafted wine from some of the finest vineyard sources that money can buy. Andy Beckstoffer (we can't disclose which ones, hint: the good ones) Hirondelle Estate in Stag's Leap, and Broken Rock Ranch on the base of Atlas Peak on the southern border of Stag's Leap. No expenses were spared at any stage of the process and it shows.

The name Nellcote comes from the Chateau where The Rolling Stones recorded “Exile on Main St.” in the Cap Ferret in southern France, just two doors down from where Tyler grew up. The name Rallye 76 is an ode to Tyler's family's rich history of designing luxury cars, primarily for racing at nearby Monaco./p>

Because of the rather sudden closing, many of the great wines from the excellent vintages were never rated (there are some out there on back vintages), but we can promise you will be seriously impressed. Silky, concentrated, lavishly rich and mouthcoating, packed with cocoa bean, espresso, blue fruits for days, clove and cola, blackberry essence, violets and a hint of bay leaf...incredibly long and polished, too.

Serious stuff for a SONG, just...wow. FIRST COME, FIRST SERVED, though!!

PAIRING IDEAS: A beautifully-made beef bourguignon would hit the spot here, with some buttery noodles and some crusty bread and cheese!

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: Because of the inspiration for the wine name, you HAVE to bump the "Exile on Main St." album! This really is one of the all-time great albums!
summary:
Nellcôte focuses on producing premium limited production Napa grown and produced wines – sourcing from a variety of highly regarded vineyards within the Napa Valley. Founder Tyler Olbres took the unusual step for a Napa producer of releasing a rosé as his inaugural wine (2013 was his first vintage). 

Both the wines and the name Nellcôte are highly personal to Tyler. While growing up in New England he later spent 10 years in his 20’s and early 30’s living and helping restore his family home in southern France. It was during this time that Tyler was introduced to fine gastronomy and wine experiences up and down the coastline of southern France including in Monaco. He came to know a number of well-regarded chefs and sommeliers and refined his palate on mostly French wines.

While growing up in New England he later spent 10 years in his 20’s and early 30’s living and helping restore his family home in southern France. It was during this time that Tyler was introduced to fine gastronomy and wine experiences up and down the coastline of southern France including in Monaco. He came to know a number of well-regarded chefs and sommeliers and refined his palate on mostly French wines.

variants.title: Nellcote Cabernet Sauvignon Rallye 76 Napa Valley 2016

title: Domaine Guy Robin Chablis Montee de Tonnerre Premier Cru 2019
description:
We’ve sold Guy Robin’s wines for years, so if you know the producer and you love Premier Cru Chablis, you’ll already be off and grabbing some. If you’re new…

When Marie-Ange Robin took the helm of the winery in 2000, she benefitted from her father Guy’s incredible foresight in purchasing a brilliant collection of vineyard plots in Chablis, including parcels in five Grand Crus and four Premier Crus. Because Guy refused to tear up vines for high-yielding clones, as was the practice decades ago in Chablis, some 80% of the family’s vines are considered “old vines”.

The Kimmeridgian soils of the Tonnerre terroir (meaning the fossilization of small sea creatures from the Kimmeridgian era) is a chalky, limestone-rich slope that helps the grapes retain acidity and express a piercingly mineral character that we crave in Chablis. Just to the south and on the same exposition as Grand Cru Blanchots and Les Clos, Montee de Tonnerre (“thunder mountain”) is often thought of as the top Premier Cru site in Chablis and often compared to the Grand Crus.

As always, this wine is almost opulent, deeply satisfying with rich, perfumey lemon creme, white stone fruits, orange flower, kaffir lime leaf, crushed rock and oyster shell notes with a satiny, lovely texture. You might think you’re drinking a pricy Puligny! While it lasts...!

PAIRING IDEAS: We’d love to drink this with a killer Lyonnaise salad. Here’s a simple recipe, but basically you are making a bacon-y salad dressing with mustard over greens and lardons and a poached egg. SO. GOOD!

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: We’ve been listening to a lot of X RAY TED – funky beats, mostly instrumental, with old school funk, R+B, and even a little disco sampling. Pretty cool!
summary: In the early 2000s, Marie-Ange Robin had a choice. Stay in Paris and pursue a successful career as a fine art dealer, or return home to Chablis and take the reins of the family winery. Her decision would not only change her family’s fortunes but also preserve a critical piece of Chablis history. Domaine Guy Robin today is a winery reborn. Marie-Ange represents the fourth generation of vine growers in the family. It was her father Guy who slowly, parcel by parcel, purchased vineyards in the 1960s; yet it is Marie-Ange who has brought the winery to a level of greatness for which it was always destined. Simply put, there are few other Chablis estates with such a rich collection of older vines, and as a result, few other estates that deliver Chablis wines of such character and complexity. Because Guy refused to tear up vines for high-yielding clones as was the practice decades ago in Chablis, some 80% of the family’s vines across five grand cru vineyards and four premier cru vineyards are older vines – these low-yielding plants deliver Chardonnay that is richly aromatic, reflecting Chablis’ historic terroir like a mirror.

title: Jean Voisin Saint Emilion Grand Cru 2018
description:
The Estate was founded in 1583 when Jean Voisin, a local citizen and eventual mayor of Saint-Émilion, established his residence on a small, preserved, piece of hillside. He quickly identified the terroir quality, as already proven by his illustrious neighbor, Château Figeac, who at the time also owned the parcels that would one day become Château Cheval Blanc and Château Petrus. The vineyard today is an unsegmented parcel surrounding the Château, and tended as 19 individual plots. Each plot of land is farmed differently according to its potential. Merlot comprises 95% of the plantings, with the rest cabernet franc.

The 2018 vintage was a tremendous one for the region, albeit after a difficult start. Downfalls of rain drenched the early clusters of grapes, and significant yield was lost to rot and mildew. What survived was then treated to a very warm and dry summer that offered excellent potential. Voisin’s 30-year-old vines, grown on sandy-clay soil with veins of the region's famous ferrous blue clay, thrived throughout the growing season with excellent water retention and a hillside exposure to minimize rot. This wine is 100% merlot, crafted in conjunction with their premier consultant Hubert de Boüard of Château Angélus, and stands as an absolute achievement.

The wine is texturally rich and supple – like liquid velvet – with black cherry, blackberry compote, plums, Chinese five-spice, licorice, and cigar box and…just so much more. It goes on and on, and at the end of the day, it is simply easy to sip and stare in wonderment as the wine coaxes you down a river of ambrosial lustiness. There’s a lot packed in this wine, and the vintage is the perfect either/or dichotomy. Drink me now, or save me for years and years later, one thing is certain…you will not be disappointed!

** Fun fact: ancestor Gabriel B. Voisin was an aviation pioneer and manufacturer who turned to making luxury automobiles between WW1 and WW2. These iconic and rare vehicles were often chosen by Heads of State and various members of well-off international societal elites. **

PAIRING IDEAS: The texture, the spices, the tremendous unctuousness of this wine all lead me to this… Galbijjim (Korean braised short-ribs) dish. Perfection!

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: The meat is braised, the wine is decanted and the evening is just getting started… complete the vibe with Duke Ellington and John Coltrane getting sentimental.
summary: The story at Chateau Voisin begins in 1583 when Jean Voysin, established his residence on an unexplored parcel of land. He quickly identified the land as promising with potential for greatness, also in part proven by his famous neighbors (Petrus, Figeac and Cheval Blanc). The 15 hectare vineyard is situated on the plateau of Saint-Emilion which is made up of the famous blue clay subsoil. Chateau Jean Voisin's objective is the never ending drive for victory of perfection and to focus their passions, knowledge and vigour into every vine and wine at Jean Voisin.

title: Halcon Red Blend Esquisto Yorkville Highlands 2019
description:
Halcon was recently sold to Pax Mahle (Wind Gap), but we worked some magic and snagged a few more cases of the 94-point blockbuster Chateauneuf-look-alike, “Esquisto”! This is the last vintage from Paul and Jackie Gordon, and these wines will be sorely missed, as they remain some of the finest values in California wine, period. How are these wines so good at this price?? If you know, you know, and are already putting a 6-pack in your cart, are we right? This is the absolute last we’ll see of them, please hurry!

Yorkville Highlands, in the cool rolling hills on your way out to the Northern CA coast and at the gateway to Anderson Valley, is an EXCEPTIONAL place to grow Rhone varietals, and Halcon is quite simply the best by a mile. Many industry insiders consider Halcon Vineyard to be home to the very best syrah in all of California, and we’re not going to dispute that. The Gordons had bought the land, set at 2,500 feet elevation — very high for a California vineyard — with rolling, uneven slopes, fast, whipping winds, and cool temperatures. The site is even blanketed in winter snow for some years. These soils are made of rocky, immensely rare (for California) blueschist ("Esquito" means "schist" in Spanish). Yields here are meager, producing small berries that look like something out of the best vineyards in Northern Rhone. While the altitude, slopes, wind, and cold can make farming here difficult, the resulting wines emphasize deeply savory attributes with a pronounced mineral edge.

This cool and energetic wine may easily remind you of an $80 bottling from Usseglio or Marcoux! In fact, do as we and other savvy Halcon fans often do, and put it in a blind tasting of Rhones and see the guesses…you’ll be amazed by how much these beauties overdeliver. Gorgeously polished, roaring with cherries, incense, lavender, kirsch and mint….a knockout at this price…honestly we couldn’t come up with a better deal when it comes to domestic Rhone blends…HALCON is king! But we’re guessing you already know that! 80% grenache, 20% syrah, with half the wine fermented whole cluster, this is just an immense delight to drink. While it lasts…!

PAIRING IDEAS: Breakout your favorite chili recipe… the depth of spice, the savory richness, the earthy, smoky warmth of piping hot mouthfuls…it all just works. Texans will say chili can’t have beans, but we say pshaw to that… go on and add those beans (and roasted poblanos, cubes of beef with the ground, and whatever else seems like a good idea at the time!).

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: Led Zeppelin rocks… no one can debate that. But Bluegrass? Listen to “Bron-Y-Aur Stomp” and tell me that’s not bluegrass. It still rocks, though.
summary: British expats Paul and Jackie Gordon fell in love with California wine made a bold move purchasing a remote vineyard in the hills of the Yorkville Highlands between Cloverdale and Anderson Valley. They then planted 15 acres with the help of seasoned winemaker Wells Guthrie of Copain Wines in Russian River Valley, Carole Meredith and Steven Lagier of Lagier Meredith Vineyard on Mount Veeder in Napa Valley, and Scott Shapley of ROAR. with a minimalist approach to winemaking and a hope to let the terroir of this unique site shine, and they do just that.

title: Domaine Blachon Saint-Joseph Blanc Les Oliviers Cuvee Tradition 2018
description:
Normally $40! Domaine Blachon is a Saint-Joseph benchmark since before WW1, and the fifth generation is making its finest wines ever! Wonderful freshness with deep, complex, mouthcoating flavors in this bottling...amazing price!

We’re extremely picky when it comes to Rhone whites in general, and MAN did this hit all the sweet spots for us! Two classic varietals at play here – 95% marsanne and 5% roussanne. Where one lacks, the other shines, and vice versa. It’s a familiar blend that has been a standard for centuries: marsanne makes a structured, full-bodied wine with a waxy texture, but lacks aromatic intensity, where roussanne is light on texture but provides lovely aromas of pear, honeysuckle, with some herbal qualities.

We love the pure freshness and complexity in this cuvee, fermented in concrete and then just a short elevage in large old barrels. Get ready! Sliced toasted almonds, lavender honey, dried apricot, rich and layered and terrifically long and heady. Wow! Pour me another!

PAIRING IDEAS: You HAVE to have shellfish here, the richer the better! Fresh sweet shrimp, lobster, scallops and rich fish like sea bass, too. You’ll want a butter sauce to dip or pour over, and, at our house, fried potatoes!

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: We like the unfussy tunes and profoundly expressive, diverse voice of Ray LaMontagne for this wine -- puts us in a happy, mellow, peaceful mood!
summary: Domaine Blachon has been bottling syrah before WW1, producing syrah that is widely aromatic, polished, and rugged. Domaine Blachon is in its fifth generation with Roger Blachon taking on the responsibility of his parent's vines in the 1970s. Roger refocused on staying regional and producing small batches of premium quality wines. Roger passed away in 2006 and the estate transitioned to Delphine and Sylvain, his children, who are inspiring vignerons and who are carrying on his legacy.

title: Domaine Blachon Saint-Joseph Rouge La Cote Cuvee Hommage Roger Blachon 2017
description:
We love this wine with unbridled enthusiasm (and the head-spinning price, of course!). We can’t wait to gush bout it, so here’s a few highlights:

- Nose: Exotic Spice Rack, Perfume, Mineral

- Gorgeous, Precise and High-Toned Aromas

- Black Cherry, Sweet Herbs, Tobacco Leaf, Sandalwood

- Super Floral

- Violets and More Violets, Lavender, Pastille, Earth

- Very Mineral, hints of Savory

- Palate: A Super Elegant St. Joseph Despite Its Ripeness

- Juicy Black Fruits, Dense, Ripe, more Mineral and Spice

- Dark Fruited, But So Utterly Fresh and Vivid

- Super Fine and Lingering Tannins

Located in Mauves, the tenderloin of the sprawling appellation, Domaine Blachon is all about location. These steep, terraced hillside vineyards overlook the Rhone river and produce classic expressions of Syrah. The Blachons have been bottling Syrah since before World War I from their exemplary and archetypal vineyards. Roger Blachon took on responsibility for his parents' vines in the 1970s. Roger refocused on staying regional and producing small batches of premium quality wines. Roger passed away in 2006, and the estate transitioned to his children, Delphine and Sylvain, who are the 5th generation of inspiring vignerons carrying on his legacy. They created today’s wine “Cuvee Hommage Roger Blachon” in his honor.

No reviews to support our enthusiasm here, but trust us, this is an incredible deal! $119.70 a six pack with ground shipping included! Dont miss...!

PAIRING IDEAS: Lamb chops are perfect, of course. Here is a good recipe that adds a bit of an Asian touch to it, which is fun with all the rich, peppery, awesome Syrah.

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: Why not listen to a podcast about Saint-Joseph? The legendary Jean Gonon talks to Levi Dalton on this podcast. Or Google “I’ll Drink To That” on Apple.

title: Domaine Marc Colin Bourgogne Aligote Prune & Gaspard 2018
description:
"I was again very impressed with the quality I found and the domain just seems to continue to go from strength to strength." - Allen Meadows, Burghound.

Indeed! Aligote is hot these days, and you can’t get a much better intro than Colin’s. Old vines (some dating back up to a century in the family) and organic farming give this crisp, fascinating white a charming, subtle minty and sweet herb-like note, with tons of exotic lemon and yuzu flavors, a cool saltiness, ultra-fresh and delicious. 5 months in used oak.

Marc Colin’s father, Pierre, planted these vines in the spring of 1946 in the lieu-dit of “La Combe” in Puligny-Montrachet. Severe pruning, horse-by-plow, and organic fertilizers keep their vines fit, giving wine of spiral depth and flavor. In the words of Damien and Caroline: “This wine captures what our grandfather and father taught us: small quantity, high quality and reflects its sense of place in La Combe. We seek fruit, energy and nerve. Aromas of white flower and of course our beloved wild fennel, typical of the varietal. Our low yields and only natural acidity produce a lengthy mouth feel.”

You WILL love it – as long as it lasts!

PAIRING IDEAS: A simple roast chicken with lemon and thyme is ideal, but try something different! In Burgundy, many a winemaker will say Aligote is fantastic with lemongrass, so try a Thai or Laotian dish with lemongrass, or make an easy one yourself here.

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: Bob Mould was the man behind post-punk band Husker Du – check out another project he had called Sugar. Try “Favorite Thing” first.
summary: Domaine Marc Colin was founded in 1970 by Marc Colin and his wife Michele. The Domaine spans 15 hectares encompassing 26 appellations in St. Aubin, Chassagne, Puligny, and Santenay and certain parcels have been in the family for more than 100 years. All of the Domaine's vineyards are situated on finely pitched hillsides resulting in wines with savory minerality and luster. Today the Domaine is run by the next generation, Joseph, Caroline, and Damien, the children of Marc and Michele. The Domaine farms sustainably and organically, with most of the vineyards consisting of older vines, and clay-limestones soils that are just some of the shining qualities of this Domain.

title: Domaine Marc Colin Chassagne-Montrachet Les Champs Gains Premier Cru 2018
description:
"I was again very impressed with the quality I found and the domaine just seems to continue to go from strength to strength." Allen Meadows, Burghound

We couldn't agree more! These wines are simply stunning and bursting at the seams with mineral goodness and charm, especially in a warm vintage like 2018. The whites are perfectly judged, never getting overripe or flabby, with wonderful natural tension and nervousness. As Neal Martin of Vinous Media said, "This is a stunning Chassagne-Montrachet from Damien Colin. Highly recommended."

title: Xavier Vins L'Esprit Francais Vendemiaire II Rouge Vin de France NM NV
description:
By now, you know – Oenologist consultant for twenty years in Chateauneuf-du-Pape and Southern Rhone Valley, Xavier Vignon is considered one of the most prominent consultants in the region. He assembles his own wines under his signature by adding a touch of modernity to the sincere expression of the Rhone terroirs. Xavier is a man who knows the terroirs of the southern Rhone Valley as well as anyone in the world, and with his massive roster of all-star clients that he consults for, it is no wonder how wines like this are possible.

L'Esprit Français Vendémiaire II is a non-vintage blend of 70% grenache, 20% syrah, 10% mourvedre, and drinks fantastically right out of the gate. Sun-drenched blue fruits galore, clear, pure cassis notes, bright, yet dark, rich, and satisfying, with plenty of spice from old-vine grenache, pepper and sweet strawberries. So GOOD and made from organic grapes.

On the last few cases...while it lasts!

PAIRING IDEAS: Tacos. Not exactly French, of course, but so good with this fun red. Asada, pastor - you pick it, just load up with them! A queso fundido would be a much-recommended addition, too!

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: The Beach Boys' “Kokomo” is one of the goofiest songs ever, but seems just right for this wine and those tacos...
summary: Oenologist consultant for twenty years in Chateauneuf du Pape and Southern Rhone Valley, Xavier Vignon is considered one of the most prominent consultants in the region. He assembles his own wines under his signature by adding a touch of modernity to the sincere expression of the Rhone terroirs. Each vintage Xavier is the fruit of meticulous work and a rigorous selection. The diversity of the Rhone terroirs, combined with the freedom offered by small structure, allows him, vintage after vintage, to select the wines that will allow Xavier's blends to combine concentration, minerality, and nobility of the fruit.

title: Larkmead Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley 2018
description:
When you are looking for truly age worthy, classically styled Napa Valley cab, look no further than the Napa icon, Larkmead. These wines are so harmonious, lush, yet precise, finely tuned, and structured. This legendary property has been making great wines for years, but MAN! This ‘18 is truly fantastic!

At the center of Larkmead’s genius is the remarkable diversity of soils (and the fact that they own an incredible swath of vineyards that are ideally situated). Centuries of alluvial flow have resulted in the accumulation of ancient riverbed gravel, clay, and loam. Located just north of St. Helena, the winery first began in 1895, and is still family-owned today by Cam and Kate Solari Baker. Then there’s Dan Petroski (Google him!) -- a master winemaker and one of the coolest, mellowest, wine-loving guys we know, who makes incredibly fine wines from the vineyard, along with his own label, Massican.

We just fell for this wine on first whiff with sandalwood, sage, cassis, spice and everything nice. The real magic is once it hits your lips, there is cool currant and pencil shavings, with almost mountain grown structure and tannic power that hints at the long evolution that this wine surely has in front of it. We have a particularly compelling price on this...while supplies last!

PAIRING IDEAS: For us? A Charter Oak (in St. Helena) burger. Smashburger (2 patties), thin, crispy, salty, with real American cheese and a bit of roasted pepper. So hedonistic. Gotta love a simple burger with a big young Napa Cab!

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: “Santa Monica” by Everclear. Yeah, it’s old, but you can’t help to rock out and scream along with it!
summary: The historic Larkmead estate is one of the oldest family-owned establishments in Napa Valley. Originally founded in 1895, Larkmead is now under the stewardship of proprietors Cam and Kate Solari Baker. Larkmead's legendary vineyard features a remarkable diversity of soils that are more typical of a hillside than the valley floor. Centuries of alluvial flow have resulted in the accumulation of ancient riverbed gravel, clay, and loam. Winemaker Dan Petroski captures the nuance and complexity of this site by vinifying small lots according to clonal selection and soil type. The 110-acre vineyard is masterfully tended by vineyard manager Nabor Camerena and viticulturist Kelly Maher.

title: Markus Molitor Urziger Wurzgarten Riesling Auslese *** Gold Capsule 2018
description: 99-point liquid gold (at very sharp pricing, of course) on one of the all-star producers in all of the Mosel. The 2018s from Molitor are once again, exemplary. As Wine Advocate notes, "This is a gorgeous, weightless and pristine, persistently salty Riesling that can be aged for decades." 99 points! We have just a handful of cases of this rare gem, grab it while we have it.
summary: In 1984, at the tender age of 20, Markus Molitor took over his father's winery with a clear aim: to produce Mosel Rieslings under the name "Molitor" in the tradition of eight generations and in the same quality that made the region world-famous 100 years ago. The wines are terroir-specific, unmistakable and extremely age able. One of our favorite Mosel producers here at First Bottle! The approx. 62 hectare steep slope facing south to south-east has a unique red slate weathered soil with a high proportion of rock, which is rarely found on the Moselle. Due to the special soil, wines from the ?rziger W?rzgarten are extremely fine-spicy, fruity, wonderfully full-bodied with a fine interplay of acids and a clear structure.

The approx. 62 hectare steep slope facing south to south-east has a unique red slate weathered soil with a high proportion of rock, which is rarely found on the Moselle. Due to the special soil, wines from the ?rziger W?rzgarten are extremely fine-spicy, fruity, wonderfully full-bodied with a fine interplay of acids and a clear structure.

variants.title: Markus Molitor Urziger Wurzgarten Riesling Auslese *** Gold Capsule 2018

title: Clemens Busch Riesling (Dry) Pundericher Marienburg Fahrlay Terrassen GG 2019
description:
"Rita and Clemens Busch are long establishing the organic domain among the finest Riesling producers in all of Germany." - Stephan Reinhardt, Robert Parker's Wine Advocate

This Riesling is EPIC. We are SO lucky to get a few cases of the Terrassen Grosses Gewachs (GG) every year - it’s like winning the lottery!

“A giant…ripeness, richness and power are perfectly interwoven” - Wine Advocate

Oh man, THAT is the truth. If you know Clemens, you KNOW. If not, hurry…it gets snapped up by savvy Riesling aficionados lightning-quick!! “Crystalline” is the word most commonly ascribed to Clemens & Rita Busch’s wines, and the new Marienburg Fahrlay “Terrassen” is a true, deer-in-the-headlights KNOCK-out. LITERALLY lip-smacking, it’s so pure and fine and otherworldly, you will wonder why you drink anything else! You all flipped for the “regular” Fahrlay GG we sold last month (and sold out of in hours), but you are not ready for the suped-up “terraced” version from ungrafted vines that are over one hundred years old! It is certified bangin’!

Organic. Biodynamic. Natural. And pioneers in moving Germany in this direction. No one else on the Mosel makes wines like these - they’re unique, contemplative and riveting and have gained quite a following, not to mention their extreme rarity! The grapes for the Terrassen cuvée are harvested on the steepest terraces of the Fahrlay grand cru, a volcanic formation of blue slate that is hundreds of millions of years old. We’ll leave with one more quote from the Wine Advocate:

“The wines are authentic, expressive and have an inimitable identity that represents the particular origin of which the terraced parts with the often ungrafted vines can give unforgettable drinking experience. These are not wines to enjoy quickly or even thoughtlessly. I'd rather recommend to drink them slowly, not too cool and with all the time they need and you are ready to give them." - Stephan Reinhardt, Robert Parker's Wine Advocate
summary: Clemens Busch and his wife Rita took over the family business in 1984 and since have shaped it into one of the most iconoclastic estates in the Mosel. A firm believer that natural practices in the vines and cellar lead to the ultimate expression of terroir, Clemens exemplifies the balance between tradition and forward-thinking we so look forward to when seeking out new producers.

seo.title: Clemens Busch Riesling (Dry) Pundericher Marienburg Fahrlay Terrassen GG 2019

A firm believer that natural practices in the vines and cellar lead to the ultimate expression of terroir, Clemens exemplifies the balance between tradition and forward-thinking we so look forward to when seeking out new producers.

variants.title: Clemens Busch Riesling (Dry) Pundericher Marienburg Fahrlay Terrassen GG 2019

title: Chateau Franc Mayne Saint-Emilion Grand Cru 2018
description:
The Savare family took over this charming property in 2018, and has taken this property from strength to strength. Anyone following this estate knows how tremendous recent vintages have been. Pulling for three distinct areas of Saint-Emilion, Franc Mayne perfectly expresses the appellation and its diverse solid types of limestone, clay, sand and marl.

This wine is pretty freaking spectacular if we do say so ourselves. Deep purple and aromatically explosive with blueberry, blackberry, black raspberry, chocolate and a myriad of florals - white, red and violets. While dark and deeply extracted, it is simultaneously light on its feel, quite mineral, fine and elegant. The flavors are brilliantly clean, and pure with red plum, blackberry, black raspberry and spice nuances.

Young St. Emilion can be a little...HUGE in their youth, but Franc Mayne's new release bucks that. It’s so fun and balanced and silky-rich. While it lasts...!

PAIRING IDEAS: So good with a seared pork chop, with mushrooms (morels if you are feeling spendy), all basted up in butter and miso and a bit of soy and hoisin.

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: An oldie but a goodie - “Lawyers, Guns and Money” by Warren Zevon!

seo.title: Chateau Franc Mayne Saint-Emilion Grand Cru 2018

variants.title: Chateau Franc Mayne Saint-Emilion Grand Cru 2018

title: Diego Conterno Barolo del Comune di Monforte d'Alba 2017
description:
Diego Conterno, the newest Conterno on the rise in a big way, just hit the warehouse (well, all 20 cases of it!). The ‘17 is serious juice and wildly well-priced in the luxury world of Barolo! 94 POINTS!

“Conterno’s 2017 is ALL CLASS” - Vinous

Certified organic since 2014, with vineyards in the Monforte d’Alba commune (the Ginestra cru, specifically), these are for the Barolo traditionalist, generally, with long, cool fermentations, medium-weight, floral and spiced aromatics, and hefty structure for the long-term. No new oak or over-extraction, just classically proportioned nebbiolo. We feel VERY lucky to have gotten on the Diego Conterno train early, yes indeed!

Certainly, the bar is high with a name like Conterno. Diego, being from the Conterno-Fantino side of the family and a protégé of the legend Beppe Colla of Prunotto. After a couple of decades making wines for Conterno-Fantino, Diego decided to go at it on his own. We just love his style (and the price!) – a perfect wine to savor a bit now, and definitely cellar into 2040 or so!

PAIRING IDEAS: Ahhhh, just thinking about this dish makes my mouth water. When we were in Piedmont a few months ago, we had Vitello Tonnato on a couple of different occasions, a surprising match for Nebbiolo and a dish that is so authentically Piedmontese.

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: Check out Dan Reeder for a musical breath of fresh air. Cue up his "Havana Burning" from his early works or check out "Maybe" from his record This New Century.
summary: This Conterno family is related to that of Conterno-Fantino through father Diego but unrelated in wine style. Diego Conterno is coincidentally located just up the slope from Giacomo Conterno, of no relation. Diego is a graduate of the Umberto Enological school and makes traditional Barolo, having worked under Beppe Colla at Prunotto. 2003 was the first vintage as Diego Conterno but the family's history dates back to post WWII. Father and son team tend to the vines and make the wines with Stefano joining in 2010. Diego has a classic style with the use of static fermenters, the use of cement tanks, and large botte which gives broad, brambly, and minerally driven Barolos. Since 2010 all the vineyards have been converted to organic and certified in 2014.

title: Verite Proprietary Red La Joie 2010
summary: The wines of Verite, French for "truth," are the result of a combination of old-world experience and new-world fruit. Each wine is a distinct blend of unique components harvested from small vineyard blocks, culminating in a meticulously formed union of grape varieties, climate, soil expression, and winemaking technique. Vigneron Pierre Seillan refers to this methodology as droit du sol, "right of the soil." Verite produces wines without compromise, wines that reflect the terroir in which they are grown. He is intimately involved in every step of the winegrowing process from bud break to bottling. Since the winery's founding in 1998, Pierre has identified more than 40 micro-crus along the western slopes of the Mayacamas Mountains in Sonoma County. These micro-crus are small vineyards within vineyards, a palette of soil types. Each vintage, the winery releases three Bordeaux-inspired blends: La Muse (Merlot based), La Joie (Cabernet Sauvignon-based), and Le Desir (Cabernet Franc based).

title: Champagne Paul Berthelot Eminence Premier Cru Brut NV (Magnum 1.5L)
description:
“Three be the things I shall never attain: Envy, content, and sufficient champagne.” -- Dorothy Parke. Magnums! As you all know, bubbly is ALWAYS better in large format, and our amazing direct-imported price makes it even sweeter.

The perennial killer Premier Cru bubbly called “Eminence” from Berthelot hails from vineyards the wineries vineyards in Dizy and Avenay, and they’ve been doing it since 1940. In the last handful of years however, Berthelot has really hit their stride. This new release is made entirely from the warm, lush 2016 vintage, and it just gets our motors running big time -- so much stone-fruity energy, candied lemon peel, packed Asian pear and croissant dough, a touch of mint and lychee with toasted apples on the finish...so GOOD! It’s built from mostly pinot noir, with 30% chardonnay with a 5.25 gram dosage. If you don’t love this stuff, we want it back!

PAIRING IDEAS: We’re making veal piccata tonight (or do chicken or fish even, if you like) with all that wonderful caper-y briney-ness – it’s perfect with this toasty bottle of bubbly goodness. Here’s an easy recipe!

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: New discovery for us, on the “surf tunes” side of things: check out Messer Chups “Pink Pantheratu”, pretty cool…!
summary: In Dizy, a village near Epernay, in the Vallee de la Marne, Paul Berthelot created a Champagne house guided by the principles of the founder, Emile Berthelot. Paul was the hospitality director from 1940 to 2000, and Jacques was responsible of the organization of the vineyard and its development since 1960. Pinot noir and Chardonnay are the majority in roughly equal parts.

title: Accendo Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley 2018
description:
In a vintage that Wine Spectator has rated higher than any other in Napa Valley history, the 2018 Accendo was only outscored by a single wine, the MacDonald Oakville Cab. That is high praise indeed, scoring the same as legends like Dalla Valle Maya, Dominus, Colgin, Schrader and Eisele. When it comes to Antonio Galloni's Vinous Media, he also waxed poetically on the greatness of the vintage and dolled out eight one-hundred point wines, Accendo being one, which he actually gave 100-points to, not once, but two different times! He went on to call it “...clearly one of the wines of the vintage”.

A treasure for the cellar…as long as we have it!
summary: Bart and Daphne Araujo sold their highly acclaimed winery, Araujo on the famed Eisele vineyard in 2012, but they are far from done in the wine industry. They have always said their best wine is yet to be made. They started Accendo Cellars to make Cab and Sauv Blanc inspired by the revolutionary Napa Valley wines of the 1950s, 60s and 70s. Wines of balance and restraint. Now joined by their children the two generations are working side by side at their new Oakville property.

seo.title: Accendo Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley 2018

title: Osborne Oloroso Solera BC 200 NV (1864) OWC (500ml)
description:
One of the great wines of this planet, 96 points, and we can tell you from experience, a wine you will NEVER forget — your epiphany of rare sherry awaits you!

This is whoa-what-just-happened-to-me wine. Intensity for days, with perfect acidity, too – the flavors just literally SOAR, explode, percolate into your brain. Brown sugar, caramel, roasted sweet nuts, espresso, creme brulee, and the length is simply astounding. With the oldest wine in the solera for this blend being from 1864, the depth and complexity is simply off the charts.

A true rarity for the serious collector… We have exactly 20 bottles! Check out our other favorite sweet wines below!
summary: One of the greatest, most historic names in the world of Sherry, Osborne stands tall among the most iconic producers in Spain. Their Rare Collection is among the most sought-after botas in the entire Sherry Triangle. For decades these old casks were only consumed by the Osborne family on the rarest occasions. Only 300 to 500 bottles are filled each year making these some of the rarest fortified wines on the planet.

seo.title: Osborne Oloroso Solera BC 200 NV (1864) OWC (500ml)

title: Champagne Paul Dethune Blanc de Noirs Extra Brut Ambonnay NV
description:
DETHUNE. We are fairly sure we were among the earliest retailers in the U.S. to latch onto the greatness over a decade ago – luckily, we still get a pretty cool allocation even with the rest of the world on board now!! Not many of these wines are made every year, and we fight to keep our allocation coming every year. But now, everyone else knows and we struggle to get much of an allocation at all! In fact, Decanter World Wine Awards, one of the world's most rigorous and lauded blind tasting competitions awarded the Brut version of this wine 97 points from this same disgorgement! In fact, the only difference from this wine and the 97 pointer is that this wine has a dosage of 3.5 grams fewer, otherwise it is the exact same wine!

Just landed is the gorgeous, massively delicious and satisfying Grand Cru BdB Extra Brut. The first ever low dosage cuvee from Dethune! HOW is this so good? WHY is it not $125?! Don’t ask. Just get 6 or more - put 3 in front to drink NOW, and stash 3 for the holidays.

This cuvee is 100% pinot noir and is vinified in 205 liter Champagne oak barrels in the family cellars, which were cut out of the chalk in the 17th century. The insider tip: (*whispers quietly*) this is a blend of almost entirely single-vineyard Les Crayeres, one of the most coveted single-vineyards in all of Champagne! This is the same base cuvee as the 95 point scoring Brut, just with a few grams less sugar and it is better for it.

This fills the room with a wonderful lime, shortbread and tonic-like aroma right off the bat, delicate croissant crust and a dash of vanilla toast, and carries it to the palate with a wave of rich, sensual texture. There is always remarkable salinity that take these wines to the next level. The balance and forwardness of Dethune is always remarkable, and a second glass is mandatory! Just the right complexity, generous personality, and amazingly long finish.

One of the best young wines from Dethune we’ve ever tasted! Could easily cost so much more...all we can say is GRAB SOME, we only got 25 cases!

PAIRING IDEAS: We know it’s cliché, but man, fried chicken is SO GOOD with a lush, happy style like this. Don’t do any crazy pickle juice brine or anything, go classic buttermilk and use peanut oil. Oh, and some honey butter will not hurt anything either!

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: For whatever reason, we’ve been cranking up this old R.E.M. tune — it needs to be wall-shaking loud — “Finest Worksong” — and sing along at the top of your lungs!
summary: Pierre Déthune learned to walk in the vineyards alongside his father Paul, who came from a long line of vintners that goes back to 1610. Like his great-grandfather Léon, his grandfather Henri and his father Paul, Pierre is tracing his own path… in the heart of the grassy wine country of Ambonnay. They do the demanding job of Grower-Producers, following a stringent sustainable development approach. As regards the line that came before them and the one that extends ahead, the couple consider themselves to be a generational relay of a timeless heritage. With quality and respect for people and the environment, they produce a range of seven champagnes that are 100% Grand Cru.

title: Bibi Graetz Testamatta Tocana 2018 (Magnum 1.5L)
description:
Over the years, we’ve been lucky to sell a bit of Testamatta, but magnums are a first, especially at this fine price. I’m guessing most of you savvy oenophiles need no introduction to Bibi’s wines, but there's a huge raft of scores and info below if you need a refresher! PERFECTION in magnums...we’re just stunned!

100% sangiovese, of course, as always, 50+ year old vines, made at his medieval castle, Castello di Vincigliata overlooking Florence. Bibi is an icon, self-taught and one of the early “cult” winemakers in Tuscany. He has a reputation of being Italy’s most talented and interesting winemakers. The labels are all personally drawn by Bibi Graetz, with the help from his daughter who both come from a long line of talented visual artists. Bibi is able to combine both of his passions into an amazing masterpiece. The wine in this vintage is five stars with wine publications predicting that this vintage will fall between the lavish 2015s and extravagant 2016s. Don't miss

PAIRING IDEAS: Try something more traditionally Florentine. Did you know they do crepes in Tuscany? Yup – check this out – crespelle alla Fiorentina. Hard to go wrong with ricotta and bechamel, are we right? Here’s a recipe.

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: Checked out the new Eddie Vedder album yet? "Earthling" is growing on us, check it out. The opening track "Invincible" is a great vibe for some world-class sangiovese!
summary: "Testa-Matta" in Italy is someone with a strong personality, a distinctive style and positive attitude and creativity. No other name could describe better Bibi Graetz flagship wine. A Super Tuscan made with 100% Sangiovese from old vines, this wine is the result of the combination of tradition and creativity, elevating the idea of Tuscan Sangiovese and bringing the word "Supertuscan" to the next level. From a medieval castle, Castello di Vincigliata, acquired by his parents over 60 years ago, winemaker Bibi Graetz crafts his wines on a hillside overlooking the great city of Florence. Beginning initially with only a small, 5-acre vineyard on this hillside in Fiesole, in little under two decades, Bibi has become one of Italy's most ingenious winemakers adding "cult winemaker" in addition to "talented abstract artist" to his dossier.

title: Pelassa Roero Riserva Antaniolo 2017
description:
Piemonte enthusiasts will know Roero as the DOCG appellation just outside of Barolo to the north of Alba, with sandier soils and rocking delicious nebbiolo wines that are MUCH easier on the wallet than the big gun Barolos. Not to mention more accessible for drinking earlier! Roero’s landscape – with its rolling hills, steep vineyards and unique sandy soils – produces some of Italy’s most intriguing wines, and PELASSA is at the top of the list!!

Dating back to 1960, Pelassa has become a quiet “insider” nebbiolo producer that those in the know scoop up whenever they can. US TOO! The Riserva is singing with bright sweet red fruits, rich yet soft tannin, and a surprisingly complex, layered flavor profile, with mineral and spicy components.

Awesome juice + PRICE! While it lasts...!

PAIRING IDEAS: Fantastic with a garlic-laden, roasted tomato pasta dish — use grilled shrimp, or sausage, or a mess of grilled veggies like zucchini or squash, even, with a generous grating of parmesan.

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: “Kick Out The Jams” by The Presidents of the United States gets your blood flowing!
summary: Located in the Mona d'Alba, the Pelassa family has always produced wine from the vineyards they owned. The present winery was created in 1960 by Mario, who has been producing and making wine from his vineyards for more than fifty years. It is a true family based winery. Maria Theresa, Mario's wife, who has had a hand in all sides of the winery - with helping Mario and her two sons in the cellar and with customers. The sons, Davide "the vine dresser" is out in the vineyards and Daniele is the face associated with the Pelassa winery who handles the marketing and distribution of the wines.

seo.title: Pelassa Roero Riserva Antaniolo 2017
seo.description: Located in the Mona d'Alba, the Pelassa family has always produced wine from the vineyards they owned. The present winery was created in 1960 by Mario, who has been producing and making wine from his vineyards for more than fifty years. It is a true family based winery. attributes.aging: 30 months, 18 months in oak, barrels and 12 months in bottle (mix between Salvonian and French wooden casks)

title: Chateau Canon La Gaffeliere Premier Grand Cru Classe Saint Emilion 2018
description:
The Chateau, itself a stone’s throw away from the legendary Chateau Ausone (this wine is typically $1000 or so!), is led by winemaking prodigy Stephane Derenoncourt, utilizes organic farming, and is basically making the best wines of its long history!

Still a baby, of course, but after a quick decanting, this is ethereally powerful and rich, with intense layers of flavor and secondary notes – just a “wow” wine any way you slice it. The 50% new oak is something we appreciate, too – it lets the gorgeous ripe fruit shine in this excellent Right Bank vintage. About 20 cases just landed direct from Bordeaux…please grab a few at this killer price while we have it!

PAIRING IDEAS: We’re already planning a dinner around this bottle, and this is going to be the main nosh: pork belly buns. We found a fantastic recipe over the weekend – here it is – Steamed Bacon Buns with Hoisin. Hedonistically awesome!

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: We’re in a Chris Stapleton mood, as of late. Check him out on your fave music platform and get in the groove!
summary: Canon La Gaffeliere is owned by Count Stephan von Neipperg whose winemaking family dates back to the 13th century. The Count also owns six other Chateaux but Canon La Gaffeliere is the most famous. The chateau is literally a stones throw aways from the famous Chateau Ausone. In the 1980's von Neipperg began implementing his organic farming practices and then hired Stephane Derenoncourt, who is renowned for his work at Chateau Pavie Macquin and Clos Fourtet.

attributes.blend: 50% Merlot, 35% Cabernet Franc, and the rest Cabernet Sauvignon

title: TerraNoble Pinot Noir Las Dichas Gran Reserva 2019
description:
This is wildly drinkable, wonderfully overdelivering pinot noir, beaming with fruit and complexity. $22 and 95 points! Amazing! Drink up!

TerraNoble is a relatively new find for us, and WHOA, were we impressed! The winery is famed for its world-class carmenere, but the pinot is our jam, oh yes! Aged in concrete eggs and older French oak barrels, it's completely fruit-focused with that Burgundian "sous bois" or forest floor, with a laser beam of raspberry and sweet Marasca cherry, baking spice and savory elements, and that much sought-after tang of minerality. Fresh and long and simply irresistible drinking! Pinot lovers, this will rock your world!

This is a serious score — take advantage while we have! There are only 35 cases...!

PAIRING IDEAS: Take chicken thighs and brush them with honey, soy, ginger, garlic, a bit of hoisin if you have, and bake them in the oven at 400. When they are done, crank up the broiler, brush a bit more glaze on, and get the skins all crispy. Dinner!

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: The Red Hot Chili Peppers have a new album out – “Unlimited Love” – check it out!
summary: TerraNoble laid down its foundation in 1993 and is owned by Chilean von Appen family. The family strives to make quality wines from their own estate vineyards. Under the guidance of winemaker Marcelo García “Our philosophy is that making the wines starts in the vineyard itself.” “We look after our noble land working with it carefully, always respecting the people we work with and trying to be loyal to our vineyards and the distinctive character of the varieties we work with. The signature style of TerraNoble is fresh wines which are expressive and enjoyable.”

title: Baker & Hamilton Cabernet Sauvignon Vine Hill Ranch Vineyard Oakville 2019
description:
Super limited. Just 8 cases, and sure to go quickly. The incredibly fresh Baker & Hamilton wine hails from the Phillips family’s beautiful Oakville property on the east side of Oakville, near Dominus ($300), Promontory ($900), Beckstoffer Missouri Hopper (which was part of VHR in the past), and Harlan Estate ($1000+) to name a few. The vineyard’s early stewards were Bob and Alex Phillips, whose dad bought the vineyard in 1959 and made it one of Napa Valley’s unheralded stars. Today, it has reached ELITE status alongside the very best vineyards in all of Napa Valley.

Baker & Hamilton was created with a bit more focus on select retailers and restaurants. It’s made in the same exact way as the $300 VHR, just sourced from the lower and slightly cooler part of the vineyard. THAT’S A GOOD THING. The wine soars with excellent blue fruit - amazingly lush, full, and delineated, with a vaguely “old school” Napa note of cedar and tobacco...we LOVED it. It’s a STEAL with all this pedigree, too – did we mention the winemaker is Françoise Peschon – a longtime winemaker for Araujo Estate who trained at Château Haut-Brion? Throw in a nod to tenured vineyard master Michael Wolf (Harlan), and you have an absolute can’t miss! Grab a couple of bottles and you won’t regret it!

PAIRING IDEAS: Don’t overthink this. Get a killer meat or mushroom pie. Make your mom’s meatloaf. Make meatballs or bolognese or cacio e pepe or a hangar steak. Make a burger. This is young, silky, delicious Napa cab — just do what comes naturally!

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: We hung out with the leader of the Dandy Warhols the other night (dude loves his Bordeaux and Napa cab!), so why not crank it up! “Bohemian Like You” is a good start, then graduate to "Horse Pills" and "Be-In" and many more.
summary: The Baker & Hamilton wine is a boutique producer coming out of the Oakville, Napa Valley area. Made by the Phillips family who are owners of the Vine Hill Ranch and have brought the brilliant Francois Pechon on board as winemaker. Francois Pechon is a rockstar winemaker with 34 harvests under her belt. She's a winemaker for Vine Hill Ranch as well as consultant for brands like Heimark, Cornell, Accendo, Matt Morris and Piedra Hill plus a few others. She's under the radar but her influence is vast and is up there with names like Philippe Melka, Celia Welch and Helen Turley.

title: Luigi Pira Barolo Vignarionda 2017
description: Vignariodnda is one of Serralunga's most prized vineyards. It is packed with active limestone, in fact, it is the highest concentration of active limestone in all of Barolo! The soils are grey marl and sandstone that are rich in microelements which give these wines their staggering complexity. This also gives the wine its beautiful acid and intense, well-integrated tannins. In warm vintages like 2017, sites like this are able to temper the ripeness and create wines that will age for decades. This wine is massively structured but also ripe and appealing young. It is a wine that when enjoyed young, should be decanted for several hours or cellared for at least 5 years. A stellar showing from one of our favorite producers.
summary: In the 1950s Luigi Pira decided to focus on grapes and wine, and in the following decades, he sold grapes and open wine to the biggest wineries in the area of Alba, which sought after high quality products from Serralunga d'Alba. It was a first step towards its own production. In the early 90s, Gianpaolo, Luigi's son, started to take part in the winery management, and the wine quality became the key factor. Today, Gianpaolo is flanked by his brothers Romolo and Claudio. Vignarionda is considered a grand cru vineyard of Serralunga d'Alba.

title: Mario Schiopetto Rivarossa Rosso 2018
description:
One of the oldest wineries in this far northeast part of Italy (past Venice and tucked near the Dolomites), Mario Schiopetto makes delicious, fresh whites and massively overdelivering cabernet/merlot/franc blends, which we are thrilled to offer to you today at this fantastic price. If this was hailing from Tuscany, you’d be paying 2 to 3 times the price, easily!

The ‘18 Rivarossa is a blockbuster, packed with black cherries, black plums, bright sweet red fruit, cigar box and sweet tobacco leaf, with silky, warming tannins and finishing with a whiff of mocha and spices...absolutely rocking delicious! Aged 15 months in large used oak, with an extra year in bottle before release, we picked up this parcel a few months back from our connection in Italy and it has just hit the warehouse.

What else can we say...? DON’T MISS! What a treat!!

PAIRING IDEAS: PIZZA. There’s so much good pizza to play with for this wonderful red. Try rosemary ham, or chorizo, or maitake mushrooms, or burrata cheese…whatever you’re feeling!

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: For my friends in Louisiana, crank up “Callin’ Baton Rouge” by Garth Brooks - country lover or not, it’s a good one!
summary: The Schiopetto estate is one of the oldest wineries in the Collio area. It was established in 1965 with the purchase of Tocai grapes and a new era in Fruili wines begun. Mario is a legend and an innovator in Italy and was part of a group of producers from the 60's and 70's that worked to improve and modernize Italian wine production. Mario passed on his knowledge to his children Maria Angela, Carlo and Giorgio who now run the estate. They all share his dedication and passion for the cellar and the vine.

title: Domaine Charles Joguet Chinon Clos du Chene Vert Monopole 2017
description: Clos du Chêne Vert is one of Chinon's most legendary sites" -Vinous Media, and a monopole for Joguet. Domaine Charles Joguet is KING of Cab Franc in the Loire, first discovered by Kermit in the late 70s and now a certified rockstar. We are BLESSED and ultra-stoked to have a few cases for you (and us!). This wine will need some time to calm down and show all it has to offer but, it also has a fruity appealing core of fruit that will make it hard to resist. We have a tiny parcel available while it lasts!
summary: Charles Joguet, a painter and sculptor by trade, abanodned his art career to begin a new profession at his family domain in 1957. Charles was a pioneer in the Loire Valley for single vineyard bottling and put Chinon on the map. Kermit Lynch discovered him in the 1970's and the rest is history. Today, Kevin Fontaine oversees the vineyards and cellar. He and his team cultivate thrity-six hectares of Cabernet Franc. The domaine bottles nine different cuvees, each one has its own unique story and terroir. Cuvee de Clos du Chene Vert is named for a monumental green oak tree that hangs over the parrcel which is a replanting of another 800 year old oak tree that was planted by the Abbey of Bourgueil in the 12th century. This is one of the oldest lieux dits in the AOC with 35 yr old vines, siliceous chalk and clay soils, and the most ageworthy of the cuvees.

title: Domaine Charles Joguet Chinon les Charmes 2018
description:
The KING of Cab Franc in the Loire, Domaine Charles Joguet is a star, discovered by Kermit in the late 70s. We are BLESSED and ultra-stoked to have a few cases for you (and us!).

This bottling of Cabernet Franc is very rarely seen outside of Europe and the quality, complexity and finesse are stunning. We are guilty of opening this far too young as their true glory lies ahead in the cellar, but boy is it tasty now!

title: Alex Foillard Cote de Brouilly 2019 (Magnum 1.5L)
description:
"That Foillard magic is clearly a hereditary thing." - Vinous Media

A little gift from the Beaujo gods! The "other" Foillard is absolutely crushing it. We were blown away by the level of complexity in the bottle here. The son of legendary Jean Foillard is on a serious roll and we expect that these wines will soon be as allocated as his fathers.
summary: Alex Foillard comes from a line of Beaujolais fame. The son of Jean Foillard, who was a part of the "Gang of Four" and paved the way for sustainable farming and low intervention winemaking in the region, it's no exaggeration that the Gamay wine bug runs deep. When Alex was young, he loved to help his father out in the vineyards and in the cellar. Alex studied agriculture at the Lyee Agricole in Montpellier and then earned a degree in viticulture and enology in Beaune. He continued his experience at internships in Australia, Japan and in Nuits-Saint-Georges. At only twenty four years old, he purchased his first vineyards in the Brouilly and Cote de Brouilly region with his first vintage in 2016 following organic principles.

title: Domaine du Vissoux Pierre-Marie Chermette Moulin-A-Vent Les Trois Roches 2020 (Magnum 1.5L)
description:
One of the true stars of Burgundy whose wines are increasingly hard to acquire, when you get your lips on the glass, it is easy to understand why! Minimalist winemaking, native ferments, little to no sulfur and the refusal to chaptalize are the tenants that make this winery what it is, they have just been doing far before it was the "cool" thing to do.

The 2020 Moulin-a-Vent Trois Roches is a stunning wine of purity and refinement with a wild flare of herbs and roasting agave alongside cassis and black raspberry. These are among the top wines made in the vintage in the region, drink it now or over the next two decades, yes, really!

"Jean-Etienne Chermette has once again produced a superb range of wines at this southern Beaujolais reference point...To my palate, some of the cuvées reviewed here number among the finest values that can be found in French wine, and I warmly recommend any readers who haven't yet acquainted themselves with this estate to try a few bottles." - Robert Parker's Wine Advocate
summary: Domaine Chermette is a family winery located in Saint-Verand, in the south of Beaujolais. The team, Martine, Pierre-Marie and Jean-Etienne Chermette combine both tradition and innovation to producing high quality wines from authentic terroirs. The family makes white, red, rose and sparkling from crus such as Brouilly, Fleurie, Moulin-a-Vent, Saint-Amour, and Cremant de Bourgogne.

title: Tassi Bruno Toscana Rosso 2019
description:
As part of our annual pilgrimage to Italy last year, we visited Fabio’s new winery just outside the village of Montalcino and tasted many a barrel sample with his winemaker. ONE, in particular, was raised 100% in amphora – 6-8 months, in fact, from grapes grown on the warmer side of the appellation - Castelnuovo dell'Abate. Fermented with indigenous yeasts, this is a wonderful expression of sangiovese – pure, mineral, complex and driving with pure red fruits.

We can’t say enough about this rare bottling – Brunello purists and the sangiovese-curious should DEFINITELY grab a few. We added about 120 bottles on with our regular Brunello order... That’s all we could get!

PAIRING IDEAS: Stay simple with a brick-cooked chicken. We like the “airplane” cut (breast and thigh) - just marinate a bit with EVOO and salt, etc. – skin-side down with a heavy pot on top, get a good sear, flip over, do it again. That’s all this pure, zesty wine wants to shine!

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: Iggy Pop’s “Candy” has been going around in our heads this morning – crank it up!
summary: The Tassi company was founded by Guido Franci who worked as a sharecropper for the Biondi Santi family since he was a young boy in the early 1900s. Guido's other passion was beekeeping and making honey on the property as well. The family ran winery is now in the hands of Fabio Tassi, Guido's grandson, who continues the tradition of winemaking and the selling of honey as well as quality products of the territory. The facility is state of the art with a gravity flow system that limits the use of pumps in a winery. The estate has a state-of-the-art facility, combined with an exceptional hospitality experience and making fabulous wines under the beautiful Tuscany sun.

title: Chateau Negly La Falaise La Clape Rouge 2019
description:
We can’t stop drinking this. How does Negly do it? Must be that fantastic property, the genius-level winemaking (Negly has too many 95-100 point scores to count) from Claude Gros, to name a few things! Beautifully polished, fresh, zesty yet powerful with deep curranty fruit, spices, wild herbs and sweet oak (judiciously done) and just a touch of olive and mocha, too. SO GOOD - 60% syrah, 30% grenache, 10% mourvedre.

The Chateau was built in the 18th century and was originally named d'Anceley, and in 1807, the name changed to Negly. Many families have owned this historic estate over the centuries, but it wasn't until the arrival of Jean Paux-Rosset, who purchased Negly in 1992, that the wines produced from these old traditional vineyards began their elevation to premier level status.

We just received our tiny allocation and all we can say is – GO! Plenty of press to read up on here, just know you are getting beautifully polished and concentrated wine with fantastic levels of complexity for pretty much ANYTHING priced like this!

PAIRING IDEAS: Lamb chops. Plan for a day of cooking (2 hours, really) with this recipe. Garlic confit is simply amazing, you can use it over and over too. Classic complements to syrah-based red with the rosemary, too – delicious.

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: We also saw Greta Van Fleet during Bottle Rock weekend, and let me tell you, they’re one of my new favorites! Blast any of their tunes - it's bound to eliminate those Sunday scaries!
summary: The Chateau de la Negly is located in the Languedoc, overlooking the Mediterranean, in the exceptional terroir of La Clape. The original Negly vineyard spanned 123 acres on clay limestone soils which gives Negly its signature palate impact and broad shoulders. In 2006 they acquired the neighboring 62 acres on alluvial sand and sandstone soils which was replanted and now is farmed sustainably and by hand. Consultant Claude Gros has further refined the work in the cellar it's not a mystery why La Negly is the top of the class in Southern France.

title: Chateau de Vaudieu Chateauneuf-du-Pape 2016
description:
Wow! Perfect all-the-time red drinking (at our price, especially!), we cannot keep our hands off this delicious bottling - it's a 2016 people - the association vintage of the century in Chateauneuf. The way this flows with pure red goodness, strawberry, raspberry, kirsch and red apple, lush, yet precise and totally focused on the fruit and the secondary garrigue-y spices. Just awesome!

Laurent Brechet has lovingly resurrected this noble domaine and established it as one of the most forward and terroir driven properties in the region. The property sits at a junction of the main soil types found in Châteauneuf. Decomposed sandstone, red clay-limestone, and galets (rolled stones) are all present, giving a broad palette of terroir to work with.

Just read the (many!) glowing reviews below, but do it quickly... We’re wishing we had more, for sure!

PAIRING IDEAS: We had the BEST mushroom dumplings this weekend, and they’d be extra fantastic with this wine, we think. Try this recipe or order them from your fave place (ours was “Lo + Behold” in Healdsburg).

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: Check out the California Honeydrop’s new single: “Get Real High”!
summary: Vaudieu is the flagship of the Brechet family. It spreads over 123 acres of the best terroirs of the appellation as one massive contiguous vineyard. Vaudieu's size and diversity is one of the crown jewel vineyards of the appellation. The estate is now run by Sylvette Brechet with the help of her sons Laurent and Julien.

title: Lerner Project Cabernet Sauvignon Project 18 Napa Valley 2019
description:
Wooden pallets. Yes, those that carry cases of wine all over the world! Stu Lerner was a highly successful pallet maker - enough so to purchase 91 acres of which 13 acres are planted almost entirely to cabernet sauvignon (clone 6), along with a tiny block of malbec. They were planted by none other than Dick Steltzner in 1983. He hired rockstar Russell Bevan, and is quietly becoming the “insider” cab for those in the know.

Bevan fans will know the vineyards in this blend – a barrel selection of fruit sources from two of Russell’s favorite vineyard sites, including Tench Vineyards in Oakville and Sugarloaf (it is worth noting that both Tench and Sugarloaf consistently score between 96-100 points). This year's blend is almost exclusively Tench (yeah, that vineyard adjacent to Screaming Eagle in Oakville!), and it is a total barnburner. If you like subtle, elegant wines, then DELETE this email, because today’s offer is a massive, no-holds-barred, uber-concentrated cabernet with incredible polish and fruit purity.

** We have just a few cases! ** First come, first served…!

PAIRING IDEAS: Stir-fried flank steak with yellow onions – perfect. Here’s a recipe. We make rice, too, and add a bit of ginger in the water (or make the rice with chicken stock), and a kaffir lime leaf if you have it!

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: EDM fans? We’re old EDM people, and a cult fave, Crystal Method, has a new album - "The Trip Home". Not everyone’s cup of tea, but worth a mention if you are!
summary: Proprietor Stu Lerner and his wife Karen have a deep appreciation for Napa Valley and the wines that are produced. They turned their dreams into reality when they created the Lerner Project and brought on Russell Bevan as winemaker. Their goals are to showcase the individuality of each vineyard and the unique characteristics inherent to each plot. The team is small but they all share the same passion and work ethic for producing wine that demonstrates the characteristics of the vine, soil and climate of Napa Valley.

title: Lerner Project Cabernet Sauvignon RMS Napa Valley 2018
description: A massive wine with the classic Russell Bevan Midas touch. This is all about pure blue and deep black fruits with incredible purity and intensity. If you like your cabernet big and bold, look no further than this beauty from one of the most sought-after winemakers in the biz.

They turned their dreams into reality when they created the Lerner Project and brought on Russell Bevan as winemaker. Their goals are to showcase the individuality of each vineyard and the unique characteristics inherent to each plot. The team is small but they all share the same passion and work ethic for producing wine that demonstrates the characteristics of the vine, soil and climate of Napa Valley.

title: Shafer Proprietary Red Relentless Napa Valley 2018
description:
"Year in year out, this is one of the superstar wineries, not only in Napa Valley and all of California, but in the entire world... One of the world’s great wines and profound expressions of Cabernet Sauvignon...The quality of the wines soared to first-growth standards, and have remained there for the last twenty-plus years.” - Robert Parker

These wines, from the quiet masterwork winemaking of Elias Fernandez (truly, one of the greatest people and winemakers in the Valley), remain rock-solid, polished, powerful and beautifully well-made wines in the entire Valley, year after year. The new wines are here and the Relentless just crushes it this year. 96-98 points and one of the most compelling versions of this wine (to my palate) since the legendary 2008 which earned the Wine of the Year honors from Wine Spectator almost a decade ago. More peppercorn, minerality and Cote Rotie-like complexity than ever before in the wine, WOW! This is also a bit lighter on its feet than previous vintages with extreme polish and beautiful balance. It's as classy as they come and a wine that should age gracefully for decades.
summary: John Shafer uprooted his family from Chicago in 1972, and bought 209 acres in what would later become Stag's Leap District. He quickly planted a small parcel of Cabernet in the hillsides above the winery at the advice of Nathan Fay and created his first wine from that planting in 1978, a precursor to their legendary Hillside Select. John's son Doug joined the family biz in 1983 and has helped shepard the winery into the international limelight.

title: Shafer Cabernet Sauvignon One Point Five Stags Leap District 2019
description:
“One Point Five remains one of Napa Valley's little hidden gems; a wine that is seldom talked about in a discussion of the very top bottlings, but a Cabernet that never disappoints.” - Antonio Galloni, Vinous

id John Shafer know, back in 1972, that his cabernet would become one of the most collectible, critically-acclaimed Napa wines ever when he planted his vineyard in Stags Leap? We have a TINY allocation (at nice pricing) of the excellent One Point Five bottling (less than half the price of Hillside, and preeeeetty close in quality!). You’ll WANT this to drink for a few years while your Hillside ages a few more, am I right?

- 83% cabernet sauvignon, 12% merlot, 3% malbec, 2% petit verdot

- Predominantly from two Stags Leap District sites — Shafer’s hillside estate vineyard and the “Borderline” vineyard located about two miles south of the winery

- 20 months in 100% new French oak barrels (Allier & Tronçais)

200% incredibly sexy and powerful and utterly captivating, too! We like winemaker Elias’ words: “2019 One Point Five fills your glass with a generous, opulent Cabernet Sauvignon offering aromas and flavors of bright black cherry, red currant, cranberry, lavender, allspice, and crushed herbs. All this lush, vivid fruit is seamlessly brought together with ripe, cashmere-like tannins that promise years of beauty ahead with careful cellaring.”

Be sure to check out the critic’s notes on this...this is one of those times where their praise seems to go even above and beyond the already fantastic scores! But, fair warning, just a handful of cases...and another fantastic, over-delivering Napa classic from your Napa buds at First Bottle! First come, first served, good people!

PAIRING IDEAS: Go with a killer cheese/meat plate. We recommend Iberico ham – get the best. And the cheese — Comte, if you can find it, is amazing. Or do as the Bordelais do and try a ripe, creamy Brie type that you can eat with a spoon.

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: We’ve been listening to some old Smithereens - we’d recommend “Only a Memory”, “House We Used To Live In”, and “Sorry” to start!

title: Shafer Proprietary Red TD-9 Napa Valley 2019
description:
“Year in year out, this is one of the superstar wineries, not only in Napa Valley and all of California, but in the entire world.” - Robert Parker, Jr.

“Shafer is one of Napa Valley's best oiled machines. Year after year the wines deliver the goods in a rich, sumptuous style that defines the very essence of contemporary Napa Valley at its very best.” -Antonio Galloni

Doug Shafer, son of his visionary father John (who took Nathan Fay’s advice in 1978 and planted cabernet in the Stag's Leap District), has led Shafer to new heights, being dubbed one of the "greatest wineries in the world" by the most important wine critic in the world, Robert Parker. We guarantee you’ll agree upon tasting this new release, they are producing the best wines in their storied history.

The 2019 is a head-turner, packed with brooding blue/purple fruits, creme de cassis, rich holiday spices, baking spice and an incredibly velvety and polished texture. A classic blend of 55% cabernet sauvignon, 33% merlot, 8% malbec, 4% petit verdot from three distinct sites, including Stag’s Leap District and winemaker Elias Fernandez aged this in 100% new Allier and Troncais barrels.

We love it. We had a little less this year, so move quickly...!

PAIRING IDEAS: We don’t do this often, but...meatloaf. It’s one of those super-homey things that warms the soul, as does this bottling from Shafer. We like to fancy it up with a few things like bacon or prosciutto, and the rich chicken stock does wonders too.

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: “Buddy” by Tim Heidecker. We all had a friend like that…

title: Dyer Cabernet Sauvignon Diamond Mountain District 2018
description:
We SELL wine here, ostensibly, but it’s a love/hate thing for sure when it comes to personal faves. I like my faves 100% under the radar!! AH WELL. Antonio Galloni just broke it wide open…

96-point Diamond Mountain cabernet sauvignons are rare, but at this price… we don’t think any other wine even comes close! Case in point, a quick dive into the interwebs will show that Antonio Galloni also rated a few other Diamond Mountain cabernets at 96 points in 2018… Lokoya ($449), Diamond Creek’s Volcanic Hill ($299), and The Vineyardist’s Heritage Ridge ($275)! Those are absolutely stellar wines, no doubt, but ponder this… by taking advantage of our three bottle pricing, you can get three bottles of this amazing Dyer cabernet for less than the least expensive, single bottle of these competitors. Puts things in perspective, doesn’t it?

Indeed. This wine is perfect for me - Napa warmth, Bordeaux-ish structure, complex, terrific balance, ages brilliantly…AHHHH. Bill and Dawnine Dyer combine 80 years of experience in the wine industry here in the Valley, and own this sublime little spot on Diamond Mountain from which they make their magic (side note: I love that Bill’s first wine inspiration was a 1964 Ridge Zinfandel). The vineyard is located at an elevation of between 600 and 800 feet; it is extremely rocky with gray gravelly soils; the yields are fairly low. Despite such a small vineyard there are slight soil variations from one end to the other – with the lower reaches showing a slightly orange color to the soil.

They make about 300 cases a year – and I drink about 3 of them! WONDERFUL WINE - what else can I say?! Except…don’t buy too much…the rest is mine!

PAIRING IDEAS: PAIRING IDEAS: The deceptively simple “Steak Au Poivre” should elegantly pair here. I always up the amount of black pepper in this by 2x.

MUSIC SUGGESTIONS: Start slow and finish with a bang, just like Fleetwood Mac and “The Chain”!
summary: Bill and Dawnine Dyer combine 80 years of experience in the wine industry with careers at Sterling Vineyards and Domaine Chandon. They fell in love with Diamond Mountain Cabernet and the expressiveness of the site. The 2018 vintage stands out as a classic Napa Valley vintage and this wine is singing. The lovely label was inspired by a mural they saw while traveling in Tibet which depicted the Diamond Mountains featured in the Diamond Sutra.
